meanings.definition: To use the teeth to cut into something
meanings.sent1: The puppy will bite the bone to chew it.
meanings.sent2: I always bite my sandwich before eating it.
meanings.sent3: Don't bite more than you can chew!
meanings.sent4: The cold wind seemed to bite through my jacket.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her words would always bite at him.

meanings.sent1: The doctor treated the dog's bite on my hand.
meanings.sent2: The mosquito bite was itchy and annoying.
meanings.sent3: He joked that the cookie had a bite of revenge in it.
meanings.sent4: The snake's bite injected venom into its prey.
meanings.sent5: The bite mark on the apple showed where it had been eaten.

meanings.sent1: She took a bite of the chocolate bar.
meanings.sent2: I offered him a bite of my sandwich.
meanings.sent3: The bite of the cake was surprisingly sweet.
meanings.sent4: The spicy salsa had a real bite to it.
meanings.sent5: The bite of the apple was crisp and refreshing.

meanings.sent1: He had a strong bite on the rope to pull it up.

meanings.sent3: The cat's bite on the toy showed its playfulness.
meanings.sent4: The vice had a tight bite on the metal rod.
